title: Conceptual Typeface Help
content:
Hello!

I have created quite a conceptual typeface that basically made up of scanned images.

What would be the best way (if there is a way) of making it an actual functional typeface.

Is there a way in FontLab of assigning each letter a .jpg?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks,  
v
author: kowchow

comments.content: If your typeface contains some color gradients or transparency, you can try FontLab's [BitFonter.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413113005/http:/www.fontlab.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=blogcategory&id=81&Itemid=40)

Tools \> Background \> Trace

You can adjust the Trace settings in Preferences.  
Before you trace, cut and paste letter scans into the Mask layer.
